title: Problem Overview
content:
**Erdős Problem #634: Triangle Dissection into Congruent Pieces**

Find all n such that some triangle can be cut into n congruent triangles.

**Status**: OPEN with $25 prize

**Known**: k², 2k², 3k², 6k², k²+m² work; 7, 11 fail; 19 unknown.

title: Triangle Structure
content:
**Triangle**: Represented by side lengths (a, b, c) with:
- All sides positive
- Triangle inequality: a+b>c, b+c>a, c+a>b

This captures the essential geometric constraint.

title: Congruence
content:
**Congruent(T₁, T₂)**: Two triangles have the same side lengths (up to ordering).

Represented as equality of multisets: {a, b, c} = {a', b', c'}.

title: Congruence is Equivalence
content:
**Congruence** is reflexive, symmetric, and transitive.

This follows directly from multiset equality.

title: Similarity
content:
**Similar(T₁, T₂)**: Side lengths are proportional.

∃ k > 0, T₂ = k · T₁

Weaker than congruence (allows scaling).

title: Dissection
content:
**Dissection(T, n)**: A partition of triangle T into n triangular pieces.

The pieces must tile T exactly (no gaps or overlaps).

title: Congruent Dissection
content:
**IsCongruentDissection**: All n pieces are congruent to each other.

∀ i j, Congruent(pieces[i], pieces[j])

title: Dissectable
content:
**IsDissectable(n)**: ∃ triangle T that can be cut into n congruent triangles.

This is the central predicate of the problem.

title: Squares Dissectable
content:
**squares_dissectable**: k² is dissectable for all k ≥ 1.

Divide each side into k parts → k² congruent triangles.

title: 2k² Dissectable
content:
**two_squares_dissectable**: 2n² is dissectable.

Uses right triangle constructions.

title: 3k² Dissectable
content:
**three_squares_dissectable**: 3n² is dissectable.

Equilateral triangle divided into 3n² congruent pieces.

title: Sum of Squares
content:
**sum_squares_dissectable**: n² + m² is dissectable for n, m ≥ 1.

Connects to number theory: which numbers are sums of two squares.

title: 27 Dissectable
content:
**twenty_seven_dissectable**: 27 is dissectable.

Special equilateral triangle construction. Note: 27 = 3³ ≠ any of the standard forms.

title: 7 NOT Dissectable
content:
**seven_not_dissectable**: ¬IsDissectable 7

**Beeson's Theorem**: No triangle can be cut into 7 congruent triangles.

title: 11 NOT Dissectable
content:
**eleven_not_dissectable**: ¬IsDissectable 11

**Beeson's Theorem**: No triangle can be cut into 11 congruent triangles.

title: Non-Dissectable Form
content:
**non_dissectable_form**: Both 7 and 11 are primes of form 4k+3.

7 = 4·1 + 3, 11 = 4·2 + 3

This pattern led to the 4k+3 conjecture.

title: 4k+3 Conjecture
content:
**Conjecture_4k3**: Primes of form 4k+3 are not dissectable.

Except for 3 (which is 3·1² and hence dissectable).

title: Open Case: 19
content:
**OpenCase_19**: Is 19 dissectable?

19 = 4·4 + 3 is prime of form 4k+3.

This is the smallest case with unknown status.

title: Conjecture Implies 19
content:
**conjecture_implies_19**: If the 4k+3 conjecture holds, then 19 is NOT dissectable.

19 is prime, 19 ≠ 3, and 19 = 4·4 + 3.

title: Soifer's Theorem
content:
**soifer_theorem**: For SIMILAR (not congruent) triangles, all n except 2, 3, 5 work.

This completely solves the similar version of the problem.

title: Similar Failures
content:
**2, 3, 5 NOT similar-dissectable**.

These are the ONLY failures for similar dissections.

Contrast: Congruent dissection has many more failures.

title: Snover-Waiveris-Williams
Zhang (2025)
content:
**zhang_2025**: For a ≥ b ≥ 1, sufficiently large n makes n²ab dissectable.

Recent progress on sufficient conditions.

title: Partial Answer
content:
**erdos_634_partial**:

- All k² are dissectable
- 7 is NOT dissectable
- 11 is NOT dissectable

This summarizes what is proven about the problem.

title: Final Status
content:
**Erdős Problem #634: OPEN**

$25 prize remains unclaimed.

Complete characterization of dissectable n is unknown.
